direct_enhancements.reason: The toString method directly calls outerHtml, making them functionally equivalent for testing purposes.
Both methods return HTML content, but outerHtml includes the element itself while html returns the inner HTML.
Both methods return text content, but text() returns the combined text of all matched elements, while toString() returns the outer HTML.
Both methods deal with text content, but eachText() returns a list of text contents from each matched element.
Both methods involve selecting elements, but select() is used for filtering elements based on a query, while toString() returns the outer HTML of selected elements.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements is a common prerequisite for both toString() and other methods that manipulate or query elements.
Selecting elements is often a prerequisite for invoking toString() to get the outer HTML of the selected elements.
Both methods involve verifying HTML content, making it useful for asserting the correctness of the HTML returned by toString().
